alert.note: Alert for Creek; Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 2:31PM CDT until August 29 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Creek, Osage, Rogers, Tulsa and Washington OK. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 230 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in some locations. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Bartlesville... Sand Springs... Owasso... Jenks... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Barnsdall... Sperry... Ramona... Ochelata... Avant... Vera... Turley... Tulsa International Airport... Jenks Riverside Airport... Wolco... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
